column4: is there a simple way of editing which daemons to autostart with ubuntu(like portmap and inetd) or do I have to edit the init.d files manually?
manually
ok. i can't seem to find which file that starts them tho :P
i'll just have to search harder.
/etc/rc2.d holds all the initscripts for the default runlevel.....if you want the full functionallity of your desktop you dont want to disable portmap
hm. portmap is only used for nfs-shares, or am i wrong?
remove or add the symlinks in the rc2.d to start or stop the services on boot
fam needs portmap
ah, ok.
then i'll let it stay.
thanks for your help
portmap on ubuntu is configured to listen only local so dont worry
i wasn't worried about that. i'm secure. i just don't want a lot of daemons runnings and take up space in mem :)
i can't understand why almost 500 mb of my memory i used..
yeah i know. but i just have like 8 mb free right now :P
guess it keeps it at that level
thats great ...as long as the system doesnt swap you should be happy that your mem gets used ;)
i get 311
much less then 512 :)
